content: Wow, what are those?

content: I see… What’s that, then?
summary: They’re shoes with lights. People use them for seeing in the dark when you get up at night.

content: Oh, that’s a cool idea! I always hit my toe on something on the way to the bathroom at night.
summary: Next is a special ice-cream scoop. This is my favorite invention. It runs on electricity and becomes hot.

content: I know what it’s for! It’s used for serving really cold ice-cream.
summary: Yes, that’s right! The last invention I’m going to write about is shoes with special heels. You can move the heels up and down.

content: Well, you can change the style of your shoes. You can raise the heels if you are going to a party or lower them if you are just going out for shopping.
summary: What are they used for?

content: Hey, did you know that potato chips were invented by mistake?
summary: Really? What do you mean?

content: Well, here on the bag it says that they were invented by a cook called George Crum.
summary: When was that? So, why was it an accident?

content: Oh, it was back in 1853. Well, one day, a customer came into the restaurant where George worked. He ordered a plate of fried potatoes. When the potatoes came, he said they were cut too thick and sent them back to the kitchen.
summary: What happened next?

content: Well, George was angry, so he cut the potatoes really, really thin, and he cooked them for a long time until they were crispy. And he put lots of salt on them so they were really salty. He thought the customer would hate them.
summary: And?

content: And the customer loved them and asked for more. He told the other customers about them, and soon everyone was ordering thinly cut, crispy, salty potato chips.
summary: And we’re still eating them today. What a cool story!

content: Tom, can you tell me a story from Europe?
summary: Well, I know one. It’s called The Emperor’s New Clothes. This story is about an emperor who loved clothes. He loved buying and looking at his beautiful clothes.

content: So what happened?
summary: Two brothers came to the city to make special clothes for the emperor. But the emperor had to give them silk and gold.

content: Were the clothes nice?
summary: Well, the brothers kept everything for themselves and told the emperor that people couldn’t see the clothes unless they were clever.

content: Did he wear the new clothes?
summary: Yes, he did. He walked through the city wearing his new clothes. Nobody wanted to sound stupid, so everyone said his new clothes were wonderful. But suddenly, a young boy shouted, “Look! The emperor isn’t wearing any clothes!”
